There are no sentences that meet the specified criteria. The text does not contain any sentences with a bioactivity metric (IC50, Ki, Kd, EC50), a specific numeric value, and a unit for that value.

All of the compounds of the present invention prepared to date exhibit potent and selective in vitro inhibition for human cathepsin S with Ki<25 nM.
Prior art compound (38) exhibits a 2.5-fold improvement in in vitro potency against human cathepsin S upon substitution of the (S)-cyclohexylalanyl moiety with (S)-(cyclohexyl)glycyl (Compound 1) but provides an inhibitor that has little selectivity verses cathepsin K, with a Ki of greater than 100-fold less potent.
Further addition of a 6-(S)-fluoro substituent to Compound 1 provides a 3.8-fold improvement in in vitro potency against human cathepsin S (Compound 2) but again provides an inhibitor that has little selectivity verses cathepsin K, with a Ki of greater than 100-fold less potent.
Alternatively, addition of a 6-(S)-chloro substituent to Compound 1 provides a 27-fold improvement in in vitro potency against human cathepsin S (Compound 3) but again provides an inhibitor that has only a modest 4-fold selectivity verses cathepsin K, with a Ki<25 nM.

Preferably, the compounds exhibit in vitro inhibition versus human cathepsin S with Ki <10 nM, more preferably <5 nM, even more preferably <2 nM and more preferably still <1 nM.
The compounds of the invention exhibit high selectivity against other mammalian cathepsins displaying little or no inhibitory activity for cathepsins K, L, B and V at 1 μM compound.

final_json.protein_target_name: cathepsins K, L, B and V

raw_mentions: Compounds of the invention when tested by the above described assays exhibit cathepsin K inhibitory activity with an in vitro Ki inhibitory constant of less than or equal to 100 nM.
